Judul: FINANCIAL ANALYSIS FOR FOUR WHEELS AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRY WITH CRYSTAL BALL FINANCE MODELING (CASE STUDY: AFTER SALES BUSINESS AS NON VEHICLE INCOME (NVI) AT AUTO 2000 BANDUNG ASIA AFRIKA)
Abstrak:
Automotive industry in Indonesia shows very outstanding performance to face one million carÃ‚Â’s market. Supporting favourable economic condition, investment increase, exports growth, and stimulate by high consumer spending which will boost automotive market in Indonesia. Although there are very promising growth in the nationÃ‚Â’s automotive industry, but we must consider the internal and external factor which influenced the sustainability of automotive business, such as rivalry among auto mobile maker and concern to government regulation (tax policy and removal gasoline subsidy). Auto 2000 as the biggest ToyotaÃ‚Â’s main dealer in Indonesia has an ultimate goal to reach company sustainable growth through quality, lead time and productivity. Its business was supported by two main foundation fields which consist of Sales and After Sales business. Sales business becomes the main contributor of income, while After Sales business turns into supporting role. Face the challenging situation reveal Auto2000 to implement Non Vehicle Income (NVI) policy in order to achieve absorption rate 100%, which mean companyÃ‚Â’s fixed operating expenses will be covered by After Sales business income. This policy was inspired by Financial Crises in 1998 which caused the collapse of Sales business, but After Sales business could make profit and showed lucrative performance.     
 
 
 

This study analyze the opportunity of NVI absorption rate in Auto 2000 Bandung Asia Afrika branch to cover fixed operating expenses by financial risk modelling with Crystal Ball (Monte Carlo) simulation method. Crystal Ball will predict future forecast based on historical data of NVI & Fixed Operating Expenses; volatility data assumption will be examined with distribution data fitting; and finally forecast data scanning. Sensitivity analysis conducted to find primary influential factor to be considered including NVI & fixed Opex. Break even analysis simulate when its parameter will achieve balance condition. Capital budgeting analysis is used to measure the viability of the investment from the constructed financial model, such as NPV and IRR through DCF method.
